intro: Parrya lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parrya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Oregon. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. Parrya lancifolia is a shrub that can grow up to 1 meter tall and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
